hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix

Class MatrixCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.MatrixCore

  • public abstract class MatrixCore
extends Object
    The data structure for a matrix implementation. This abstract class specifies the bare necessities required for a matrix, without any of the convenience methods and types provided by the Matrix interface hierarchy.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MatrixCore(int rowCount, int colCount)
      Creates a new instance with the specified dimensions.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColumnCount()
      Returns the number of columns.

      Retrieves an element of the matrix without checking the arguments.
      int getRowCount()
      Returns the number of rows.
      abstract void setQuick(int row, int col, double value)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatrixCore

        public MatrixCore(int rowCount,
          int colCount)
        Creates a new instance with the specified dimensions. The dimensions must be specified at construction time because matrix implementations are not allowed to change size.
        Parameters:
        rowCount - the number of rows
        colCount - the number of columns
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is non-positive

    • Method Detail

      • getRowCount

        public final int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows.
        Returns:
        the number of rows

      • getColumnCount

        public final int getColumnCount()
        Returns the number of columns.
        Returns:
        the number of columns

      • getQuick

        public abstract double getQuick(int row,
              int col)
        Retrieves an element of the matrix without checking the arguments. If the row or the column index is invalid, the behaviour of this method is unspecified. For example, it may return some value or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        Returns:
        the element at the specified position

      • setQuick

        public abstract void setQuick(int row,
            int col,
            double value)
        Updates an element of the matrix without checking the indexes. If the row or the column index is invalid, the behaviour of this method is unspecified. For example, it may set some element or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index
        col - the column index
        value - the new value
